anyOf.description: An animal that is amenable to experimentation and whose physiological or pathologic mechanisms are sufficiently similar to those of a human for the animal to serve as a model.
hPSC-derived three-dimensional in vitro culture systems that recapitulate the developmental processes and organization of the developing human brain.
A biosample consisting of cells isolated from animal tissue that have acquired the ability to proliferate indefinitely.

Induced pluripotent stem cells; adult cells that have been genetically reprogrammed to an embryonic stem cell-like state by the expression of genes and factors important for maintaining the defining properties of embryonic stem cells.

A three dimensional mass comprised of a cultured cell or tissue sample that resembles an in vivo tissue or organ. Organoids are grown in vitro from a combination of cells or tissue fragments cultured in medium containing a variety of biochemical factors.
The cells taken from a tissue source, and their progeny, grown in culture before subdivision and transfer to a sub culture.
